title: Mr_Peter Ben
author: Mr_Peter Ben
content: Today, I've signed up on Bitcointalk because it seems to be really interesting for a lot of Bitcoin contributions. It is interesting to see, how Satoshi achieved to grow Bitcoin community and how he created a very good coin, making it possible to establish Bitcoin and Bitcointalk was very important to make it succesfull. Satoshi build Bitcoin and as a coder, he really listened to community feedback and tried to explained it because Bitcoin was (and is) still very technical. Bitcoin is a great technological piece because Bitcoin needs to be safe from hacker. Much money is stored in Bitcoin network and if it's not safe, we are screwed, everyone. But Satoshi was good coder, he made it safe. Bitcoin is safe now for 10+ years and many hacker tried to hack Bitcoin. No hacker succeeded because Bitcoin is proven to be safe. It is very, very unlikely for Bitcoin to be proven unsafe after 10 years of hacker review. I don't read hacker news but it's common sense. I'm not coder, so I don't understand it but of course I tried to have education because education is always important for any issue. Like for Bitcoin, we can already summarize a few points: - not your keys, not your coins- decentralisation is important- always research first to avoid scam or shitcoinI hope, I'm not late for Bitcoin because Bitcoin already grew a lot. Also, Bitcointalk has many established member. I try to make a good contribution, I try to be polite ofcourse. Bitcointalk has many interesting topic. Everyone who knows Bitcoin should know Bitcointalk. And we can learn A LOT from Bitcointalk. Happy to be here and learn.

comments.author: Amphenomenon
comments.body: Welcome to bitcointalk, it seems like you already have idea about how this forum works but this post might makes it easier for your learning process Helpful Guides For Newbie on the Electrum Wallet.Also you are far from being late for Bitcoin though its over a decade since it was created but Bitcoin has many many more years so you can't be late now.

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: Welcome, and now that you have expressed your enthusiasm, I recommend that you use the forum on a daily basis to learn mainly, since you say you don't know much, and with time you will also be able to contribute your knowledge and exchange impressions. That's what a forum is for. If you have doubts about the technical aspects, people who know a lot are quite helpful but you'd better do some research to have a minimum of knowledge before asking.

comments.author: zaim7413
comments.body: Welcome to the forum.I'm sure you studied Bitcoin before joining the Bitcointalk forum, your presentation at the start of the topic was very clear and I have no doubts about your abilities. It's never too late to trade and invest in Bitcoin even though its development has been very rapid. Here you can develop knowledge about Bitcoin and alternative Cryptocurrencies to become an established Investor, here you can get something that might be hard to find elsewhere. The first thing you need to do is increase your account knowledge and ranking to become an established member of the Bitcointalk forum.

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: Quote from: Mr_Peter Ben on July 29, 2023, 01:10:15 AMBitcoin is safe now for 10+ years and many hacker tried to hack Bitcoin. No hacker succeeded because Bitcoin is proven to be safe.Hack Bitcoin is a vague phrase.Hack a Bitcoin wallet software, hack a Bitcoin wallet, hack a website that provides online wallet, paper wallet, attack the Bitcoin network. What did you mean about hack Bitcoin?About network attack, Bitcoin network has very high hashrate, very decentralized and risk to have such attacks is very slim.How many Bitcoin confirmations is enough?More important, if an attacker does such an attack, Bitcoin price will be dumped to the hell and even the attacker will not get much money from it.Practice with Bitcoin confirmation risk calculatorshttps://web.archive.org/web/20181231045818/https://people.xiph.org/~greg/attack_success.htmlhttps://jlopp.github.io/bitcoin-confirmation-risk-calculator/

comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on July 29, 2023, 06:20:51 AMI always get pretty skeptical when I see posts from new users that are pretty much just overly praising Bitcointalk as if it was some crypto's version of Jerusalem lol.Welcome, I guess. Don't you get surprised when you see a newbie account registered a week ago and started writing about improving post quality and what mistakes they should not make in Bitcointalk? I know some skillful coders and I invited them to Bitcointalk, but they said they don't have time for BitcoinTalk.

comments.author: aylabadia05
comments.body: Set aside your free time for forums instead of spending your free time scrolling through social media because by getting used to being active in forums you will gain a variety of knowledge about Bitcoin.You are not late and you will later find people who come after you with the words that I hope I am not late.I want to say don't push yourself because for a goal, direction is more important than speed. comments.author: Patrol69
comments.body: First of all congratulations on this forum. Everything seems so amazing to you because you just started in this forum but when you become a regular member of the forum you can tell about these things to the people who sign up as a newbie and want to know about these things. Bitcoin is an amazing invention. Just as the US dollar is used by people all over the world, Bitcoin is used by people in different countries around the world. While you cannot use US dollars as an investment, you can use Bitcoin as an investment. Bitcoin is a digital currency with which it is possible to conduct almost all types of activities such as with Bitcoin you can trade, invest for a long time, and in all countries where Bitcoin has a legal document, you can do various transactions through Bitcoin.

comments.author: alastantiger
comments.body: I like your passion and enthusiasm. It's good. While you are here take the time to read and learn more about the forum while you are learning about Bitcoin. Bitcointalk has changed lives of many users and it can change your own life too and put you in a good, better or best position if you set your goals of what you wish to achieve by being here. That is all that matters. I would also like to give you a heads up that newbies often face critical comments on their posts by higher ranking members, therefore you should expect it and develop a thick skin. And if you feel it is too harsh, you can take some days off for your mental health. I wish you more bitcoins to your wallet.

comments.body: Quote from: Mr_Peter Ben on July 29, 2023, 01:10:15 AMSatoshi build Bitcoin and as a coder, he really listened to community feedback and tried to explained it because Bitcoin was (and is) still very technical. Bitcoin is a great technological piece because Bitcoin needs to be safe from hacker. Much money is stored in Bitcoin network and if it's not safe, we are screwed, everyone. Bitcoin was not hacked, not because it is safe or because Satoshi developed it securely, and if this is true, it is because of its nature. Bitcoin, by its central nature, cannot be hacked because it is not the servers of a central company or service, but only paired spending is possible if the hackers have the longest chain starting from 51% from the network to launch a successful attack. learn a lot in a short time by reading some books or watching YouTube videos.
